name: Christmas Sugar Cookies
instructions: Beat butter & sugar together until light and fluffy.
Whisk dry ingredients in a separate bowl.
Add dry ingredients to wet and mix just until dough forms. (Dough should be soft but not sticky.)
Roll dough between two sheets of parchment to ~¼ inch thick.
Cut shapes and place on parchment-lined baking sheets.

icings.name: Royal Icing
icings.description: Best for: Detailed designs, clean lines, stacking cookies, gifting

ingredients.name: Vanilla Extract
ingredients.amount: ½ tsp vanilla or almond extract (optional)

instructions: Add water gradually while mixing until smooth.
Decorate with dots, marbling, or layered colors.
icings.pros: Best for: Intricate designs, stacked cookies, professional look

icings.name: Glaze Icing
icings.description: Best for: Quick decorating, shiny finish, minimal tools
icings.finish: Glossy, slightly soft but sets firm

ingredients.name: Vanilla Extract
ingredients.amount: ½ tsp vanilla or almond extract

instructions: Whisk sugar and 2 Tbsp liquid until smooth.
Add more liquid drop-by-drop until it slowly drips off a spoon.
Tilt cookie to spread, or smooth with a spoon.
icings.pros: Best for: Casual decorating, kids helping, quick batches

icings.name: Buttercream Icing
icings.description: Best for: Texture, flavor, piping designs, "bakery-style" cookies

ingredients.name: Butter
ingredients.amount: ½ cup (1 stick) unsalted butter, softened

instructions: Beat butter until smooth and creamy.
Beat in milk and vanilla until fluffy.
icings.pros: Best for: Soft decorating, flavor-first cookies
